definition: to regard as/to treat as
to look at/to regard/to inspect
old variant of 視|视[shi4]
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: The Maybach has been adopted as the ultimate status symbol by Russia's super-rich.
sentences.chinese: 迈巴赫被视作俄国超级富豪的”终极身份象征“。

sentences.english: We see this platform as winning.
sentences.chinese: 我们把这个平台视作一种胜利。

sentences.english: In feudal society, the dragon also be regarded as a symbol of the emperor.
sentences.chinese: 在封建社会，龙更被视作帝王的象征。

sentences.english: It sees the dead as lovers, too.
The Boxer episode is commonly portrayed in the West as an orgy of anti-foreign violence.
sentences.chinese: 在西方，义和团被视作反西方的暴力狂欢。

sentences.english: Bituminous coal is often treated as a consistent and homogeneous product.
sentences.chinese: 烟煤一般被视作一种质地均匀一致的产品。

sentences.english: All the cultural activities in Gannan should be regarded as hakka culture occurancies.
sentences.chinese: 历史上发生于赣南的文化事象都应视作客家文化。

sentences.english: In the a ence of such indication, the credit shall be deemed to be revocable.
sentences.chinese: 如无该项表示，信用证应视作是可撤销的。

sentences.english: Before being liberated from slavery, these people had been scorned and used and treated as outcasts.
sentences.chinese: 以色列人脱离奴役前，饱受嘲弄利用，被视作贱民。

sentences.english: Reporters used to be considered non-combatants. Not anymore.
sentences.chinese: 记者通常被视作非战斗人员，现在就不行了。

sentences.english: I could have him for my fellow worker but not for a friend.
sentences.chinese: 我可以把他看做我的同事，却不能视作朋友。

sentences.english: Management dismissed the union's behavior as irresponsible and unreasonable.
sentences.chinese: 管理层把工会行为视作不负责任和无理要求草草处理。

sentences.english: So exactly what in this case is supposed to be delusive?
sentences.chinese: 那么，这个例子中究竟有什么应被视作欺幻呢？

sentences.english: Payment made before mid- night on the due date will be regarded as on- time payment.
sentences.chinese: 于到期日午夜前缴款会被视作准时缴交。

sentences.english: There was no room for details that were to be viewed as individual elements.
sentences.chinese: 细节不应被视作独个的元素。

sentences.english: In four seasons with Cleveland, Diop was deemed a bust.
sentences.chinese: 在克里夫兰的4个赛季，迪奥普被视作水货。

definition: to view as/to see as/to consider to be/to deem
to regard as/to look upon as
to look upon as/to regard as
to treat as/to regard as
to treat as/to regard as/to look upon as
to regard as
to consider as/to take to be
to be called/to be known as
one's conduct/deed/activity/accomplishment/achievement/to act as/as (in the capacity of)/qua/to view as/to look upon (sth as)/to take sth to be
in fact/in reality/actually/as a matter of fact/de facto/ipso facto
to assign (to a class)/to classify as/to include
really isn't
to label/to call
to liken to/to compare to
to take as a guiding principle (idiom)
to act as/used erroneously for 作為|作为
